title: Victim in shooting death near Churchill Downs was close to suspect's family
content:
LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - An 18-year-old man has been charged with murder following the Thursday morning shooting death of a man near Churchill Downs.
According to a police report, officers responded to a home in the 900 block of W. Evelyn Avenue in the Wyandotte/Oakdale neighborhood just before 3 a.m. on Thursday. They located the victim, Dustin J. Osborne, 19, suffering from a gunshot wound.
Police said Rion J. Graves admitted shooting Osborne. The Jefferson County Coroner's Office said Osborne died from a gunshot wound to the chest.
Residents who live in the Oakdale neighborhood said the shooting isn't a surprise. They said there have been problems coming from the house for some time and they suspected drug activity.
+ MUGSHOTS: April 2016 Roundup
"Seen a lot of activity people coming and going and we suspected that the young man was dealing drugs," resident Richard Sarver said.
"This is what's pulling the neighborhood down, people moving in that just don't seem to care," President of the Oakdale Neighborhood Association Barbara Devereaux said.
Graves' mother said Dustin Osborne was very close to her family. She said she and Osborne's father dated many years ago.
WAVE 3 News also discovered Graves was released from the Clark County Jail in January on a possession of marijuana charge.
Graves is being held at Louisville Metro Department of Corrections on a $100,000 bond. He is scheduled to be arraigned Friday morning on his murder charge.
